summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to USAA Federal Savings Bank, dated December 11, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities. The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity). It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary individual named in the subpoena's rider, whose financial records and those of her associated entities are being sought by the grand jury.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the subpoena as part of the grand jury investigation targeting Maxwell and her financial activities.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which USAA Bank is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to the transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity.
It seeks extensive financial records from USAA Bank for Ghislaine Maxwell and several entities: Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, and Max Hotel Services Corp.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests the bank not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The requested records are comprehensive, including bank statements, wire transfers, credit card statements, loan applications, 'know your customer' documentation, and even online banking IP logs.
The document indicates the investigation was active and seeking detailed financial evidence as of December 2019, prior to Maxwell's arrest in July 2020.
